info.name: Striate cortex
info.description: Striate cortex is the primary visual cortex located within the calcarine sulcus of the occipital lobe.  It is called Area 17 in Brodmann's designation. It is named for a sheet of myelinated nerve fibers that form a stripe (Stripe or Line of Gennari) in layer IV of the cortex that is visible with the naked eye.
